James_Barker_Band:
{{Short description|Canadian country group}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = James Barker Band | image = james barker band 2019.png | landscape = yes | image_size = | caption = James Barker Band in 2019
From left to right: James Barker, Taylor Abram, Bobby Martin, and Connor Stephen | alias = | origin = [[Woodville, Ontario]], Canada | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | years_active = 2015–present | label = {{hlist|[[Universal Music Canada]]|Records|Starseed|[[Sony Music Nashville]]|Villa 40}} | website = {{URL|http://www.jamesbarkerband.com/}} | current_members = * James Barker * Taylor Abram * Connor Stephen * Bobby Martin | past_members = }} The '''James Barker Band''' is a Canadian country group formed in [[Woodville, Ontario]], in 2015. The band consists of James Barker, Taylor Abram, Connor Stephen, and Bobby Martin.{{cite news|last1=Whitaker|first1=Sterling|title=James Barker Band Get 'Lawn Chair Lazy' in New Video [Exclusive Premiere]|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/james-barker-band-lawn-chair-lazy-video/|access-date=March 25, 2017|work=[[Taste of Country]]|publisher=[[Townsquare Media]]|date=June 29, 2016}} In Canada, they have four number one country singles with "[[Chills (James Barker Band song)|Chills]]", "[[Keep It Simple (James Barker Band song)|Keep It Simple]]", "[[Over All Over Again]]", and "[[New Old Trucks]]". ==Career== In 2015, they won the Emerging Artist Showcase at the [[Boots and Hearts Music Festival]] and the following year, they were signed to [[Universal Music Canada]].{{cite news|last1=Doolan|first1=Susan|title=Band catches a big break at festival|url=http://www.thebarrieexaminer.com/2016/07/15/band-catches-a-big-break-at-festival|access-date=March 25, 2017|work=[[The Barrie Examiner]]|publisher=[[Postmedia Network]]|date=July 15, 2016}} The band's debut [[extended play]], ''[[Game On (EP)|Game On]]'', was released April 21, 2017.{{cite news|title=James Barker Band: Video + EP Release Date|url=http://www.iheartradio.ca/new-country-94/news/james-barker-band-video-ep-release-date-1.2493419|access-date=March 25, 2017|work=[[iHeartRadio]]}} The band received two [[Juno Award]] nominations for [[Juno Award for Breakthrough Group of the Year|Breakthrough Group of the Year]] and [[Juno Award for Country Album of the Year|Country Album of the Year]] at the [[Juno Awards of 2018|2018 Juno Awards]],[http://www.cbc.ca/music/junos/junos-news/arcade-fire-and-daniel-caesar-lead-2018-juno-award-nominations-1.4520940 "Arcade Fire and Daniel Caesar lead 2018 Juno Award nominations"]. [[CBC Music]], February 6, 2018. winning the second.[https://www.cbc.ca/music/junos/news/junos-2018-the-complete-list-of-winners-1.4579405 "Junos 2018: the complete list of winners"]. ''CBC News'', · March 25, 2018 In 2018, the band's song "[[Chills (James Barker Band song)|Chills]]", cowritten by Barker, Gavin Slate, Travis Wood and [[Donovan Woods (musician)|Donovan Woods]], received a [[SOCAN Songwriting Prize]] nomination[http://exclaim.ca/music/article/2018_socan_songwriting_prize_nominees_revealed "2018 SOCAN Songwriting Prize Nominees Revealed"]. ''[[Exclaim!]]'', May 24, 2018. and won the award for Single of the Year at the [[Canadian Country Music Awards]].[https://www.cbc.ca/news/entertainment/2018-canadian-country-music-awards-shania-twain-hamilton-1.4816712 "Host Shania Twain is big winner at 2018 Canadian Country Music Awards"]. [[CBC News]], September 9, 2018.[https://www.thechronicleherald.ca/living/the-best-nova-scotia-concerts-of-2018-270134/ "The best Nova Scotia concerts of 2018"]. ''Chronicle Herald'', Stephen Cooke, Dec 20, 2018 The band became the first artist to record a globally released [[Spotify Singles]] session in Canada in November 2018.{{cite web |title=Spotify Singles |url=https://open.spotify.com/album/0AccJ5bsbh5fiF4uPaQuyE |website=[[Spotify]] |publisher=[[Universal Music Group]] |date=November 7, 2018}}{{cite web |title=James Barker Band Release Their Spotify Singles Session |url=http://www.umusic.ca/press-releases/james-barker-band-release-their-spotify-singles-session/ |website=[[Umusic]] |date=November 7, 2018 |access-date=January 20, 2019 |archive-date=January 20, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190120043158/http://www.umusic.ca/press-releases/james-barker-band-release-their-spotify-singles-session/ |url-status=dead }} Their second extended play, ''[[Singles Only (EP)|Singles Only]]'', was released May 24, 2019.{{cite web|title=James Barker Band Return With Their Sophomore EP, Singles Only|url=http://www.umusic.ca/press-releases/james-barker-band-return-with-their-sophomore-ep-singles-only/|website=UMusic.ca|publisher=[[Universal Music Canada]]|access-date=April 27, 2020|archive-date=June 22, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200622001018/http://www.umusic.ca/press-releases/james-barker-band-return-with-their-sophomore-ep-singles-only/|url-status=dead}} They would follow that up with the standalone single "[[Summer Time (song)|Summer Time]]" in June 2020,{{cite web|first=Katie|last=Colley|url=https://etcanada.com/news/656068/james-barker-band-are-on-summer-time-with-their-catchy-new-single/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200612191459/https://etcanada.com/news/656068/james-barker-band-are-on-summer-time-with-their-catchy-new-single/|url-status=dead|archive-date=June 12, 2020|title= James Barker Band Are On 'Summer Time' With Their Catchy New Single|work=[[Entertainment Tonight Canada|ET Canada]]|publisher=[[Corus Entertainment]]|date=June 12, 2020|access-date=June 13, 2020}} and the extended play ''JBB-Sides'' in August 2020.{{cite web|url=https://etcanada.com/news/674944/james-barker-band-honours-singers-late-nana-in-new-track-mamas-cooking/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200806111700/https://etcanada.com/news/674944/james-barker-band-honours-singers-late-nana-in-new-track-mamas-cooking/|url-status=dead|archive-date=August 6, 2020|title=James Barker Band Honour Singer's Late Nana In New Track 'Mama's Cooking'|first=Katie|last=Colley|date=July 31, 2020|work=[[Entertainment Tonight Canada|ET Canada]]|access-date=September 9, 2020}} In May 2021, they signed a record deal with [[Sony Music Nashville]] and Villa 40, and released the single "[[Over All Over Again]]",{{cite web|first=Lydia|last=Farthing|title=Canadian Group James Barker Band Signs To Villa 40/Sony Music Nashville|url=https://musicrow.com/2021/05/canadian-group-james-barker-band-signs-to-villa-40-sony-music-nashville/|website=Music Row|date=May 14, 2021}}{{cite web|first=Lauren|last=Laffer|title=James Barker Band Debuts New Single, 'Over All Over Again'|url=https://www.soundslikenashville.com/news/james-barker-band-over-all-over-again/|website=Sounds Like Nashville|date=May 14, 2021}} which became their third Canada Country number one. In October 2021, they released the song "[[New Old Trucks]]", which features American country singer [[Dierks Bentley]].{{cite web|url=https://www.thecountrynote.com/in-the-news/james-barker-band-teams-up-with-dierks-bentley-for-new-old-trucks/|title=James Barker Band Teams Up With Dierks Bentley for "New Old Trucks"|date=October 8, 2021|access-date=October 12, 2021|work=The Country Note}} They followed that up with "[[Wastin' Whiskey]]" in 2022 on Starseed Records.{{cite web|url= https://canadianbeats.ca/2022/03/29/james-barker-band-delivers-what-could-be-another-1-single-with-the-release-of-wastin-whiskey/|title=James Barker Band delivers what could be another #1 single with the release of "Wastin' Whiskey"|date=March 29, 2022|first=Nanci|last=Dagg|work=Canadian Beats Media}} In the spring and summer of 2022, the band joined [[Dallas Smith]] as opening acts on his headlining "Some Things Never Change Tour" across Canada.{{cite web|title=Dallas Smith has announced The Some Things Never Change 2022 Tour and debuted his new single "Hide from a Broken Heart" at a special performance on CCCMA Awards Show|url=https://canadianbeats.ca/2021/11/29/dallas-smith-has-announced-the-some-things-never-change-2022-tour-and-debuted-his-new-single-hide-from-a-broken-heart-at-a-special-performance-on-oh-cccma-awards-show/|first=Nanci|last=Dagg|work=Canadian Beats Media|date=November 29, 2021}} In January 2023, the band signed with Records Nashville, a joint venture between [[Sony Music Entertainment]] and [[Barry Weiss]], and released the single "[[Meet Your Mama]]".{{cite web|url=https://musicrow.com/2023/01/james-barker-band-joins-records-nashvilles-growing-roster/|title=James Barker Band Joins Records Nashville's Growing Roster|first=Lydia|last=Farthing|date=January 23, 2023|work=Music Row Magazine|access-date=January 23, 2023}} They would follow that up with the single "[[On the Water (song)|On the Water]]" featuring American country artist Dalton Dover in May of 2023.{{cite web|url=https://countryswag.com/james-barker-band-dalton-dover-new-song/|title=James Barker Band Collabs with Dalton Dover on New Song "On the Water"|date=May 26, 2023|first=Erica|last=Zisman|work=Country Swag|access-date=May 27, 2023}} Both songs are included on their extended play ''[[Ahead of Our Time]]'', which was released on October 20, 2023.{{cite web|url=https://musicrow.com/2023/09/james-barker-band-pops-champagne-for-upcoming-ep-ahead-of-our-time/|title=James Barker Band Pops 'Champagne' For Upcoming EP 'Ahead Of Our Time'|work=Music Row|first=Lorie|last=Hollabaugh|date=11 September 2023 |access-date=September 23, 2023}} ==Discography== ===Extended plays=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders"
